p: Within this context, the study of the therapeutic properties of plants that may represent an alternative therapeutic resource has increased [ 12– 14]. One of the plants investigated over time for exhibiting significant biological properties is Cinnamomum zeylanicum Blume, commonly known as cinnamon. Several parts of the plant, such as the bark, leaves, flowers, fruits, and roots, have medicinal and culinary applications. The chemical composition of the materials obtained from the different parts of a plant exhibit considerable variation, resulting in different pharmacological effects [ 15– 18].
